result.execSummary:
The defendant James M Burke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Dodge Correctional Institution as reception facility. Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.  Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Consecutive to: any sentence Defendant is currently serving.

superMiscConds.notes: $2500.00 bond will first be applied to any restitution in 15CF435 and if any remains it will be applied to court costs in 15CF435 & 15CF440. If there is any remaining bond it will be returned to whomever posted it. If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.  Attorney Fees To Be Determined.  Probation does NOT collect attorney fees.
Must maintain absolute sobriety. Must not possess any firearms.

Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.  Order for DNA given to the defendant in court. Must report to the Barron County Jail immediately to submit DNA sample.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any other sentence the Defendant is currently serving.

Court resumes at 3:40.  Defense notes two changes on PSI.  3:44 Barron County Sheriff's Department, Detective Mary Dexter, called, sworn and direct by state.  Exhibit 1 - copy of information taken from DE's phone regarding a felon possessing firearms & 2 - copy of Detective Dexter's interview of D.B. offered by state, received by court. 3:50 Argument by state.  4:00 Argument by defense. 4:14  Defendant addresses the court.

15CF435.
3 years prison. Consecutive to 15CF440 and any sentence currently serving. 
1 year, 6 months initial confinement. Zero Credit for time served.  
DE is eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs. 

1 year, 6 months extended supervision.

Must maintain absolute sobriety. 
Must not possess any firearms.
Restitution to be held open for 30 days. 
Costs.

Defendant James M Burke in court with attorney Stephen Donald Willett.  Defendant James M Burke in custody.  Investigator John White in court.  John Michael O'Boyle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Detective Mary Dexter in court. Covers 15CF435, 15CF440, and 15CF541.
15CF440 and 15CF541 - Review in deciding State's motion for Other Acts Evidence and it's Motion for admission of videotaped interview of victim.
Court relates on previous hearing and order.
State offers the exhibit (DVD/disk) that was discussed at last week's hearing in 15CF541 in case that wasn't done. Received by Court.
State relates. Attorney Willett relates. 
Court relates and finds no weight or persuasiveness in Other Acts Evidence in intent or motive for prongs 1 and 2, but finds relevance for prong 3, and that some evidence will be admissible, but some will not be under 904.04(2)(a).  
Court grants States Motion in part with admitting the conduct that was alleged in Birchwood and permitted under Other Acts Evidence rule. With regards on whether video/s are admissible under 908.08; Court finds victim was not coached or coerced during interviews and allows them to be used as evidence for trial.

JT to be set for 4 days as #1 for February 13,14,15,16, 2018 for 8:00 a.m.
Extensions for any revised Jury Instructions, Verdict Forms and any Motions are to be filed no later than 1/23/18. State to prepare the Order.  
State relates that Detective Dexter will do an updated DVD/disk to put all interviews on one and a copy will be given to Defense.

15CF435 - Motion to dismiss for insufficient information filed by Defense. State relates. Court relates and denies the motion at this time. 

Court orders all cases to track to 12/2/16 at 2:30 PM before Judge Boyle if not already scheduled.
